summary: This is an email chain from January 28, 2021, regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. An FBI agent from the New York Office's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force forwards an external email to an Assistant United States Attorney, inquiring if any jail calls have been obtained in connection with the Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email inquiry is about obtaining jail calls in connection with the ongoing investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The email is forwarded to an unnamed Assistant United States Attorney at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, who is presumably involved in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: The Assistant United States Attorney is part of the prosecutorial team investigating Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by the email inquiry about obtaining evidence (jail calls).

events.title: Inquiry about Maxwell Jail Calls
events.description: An FBI agent forwards an external email to a federal prosecutor inquiring if any jail calls have been obtained in the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: The email is dated January 28, 2021, during Ghislaine Maxwell's pre-trial detention.
The FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force in New York is actively involved in the investigation.
Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York are seeking evidence in the form of jail calls.
The communication highlights ongoing evidence-gathering efforts by law enforcement in the Maxwell case.
